text: proper use of list comprehensions - python
Normally, list comprehensions are used to derive a new list from an existing list.

code:
>>> a = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]
>>> [i for i in a if i > 2]
[3, 4, 5]

text: Should we use them to perform other procedures?

code:
>>> a = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]
>>> b = []
>>> [b.append(i) for i in a]
[None, None, None, None, None]
>>> print b
[1, 2, 3, 4, 5]
